titleStmt.title: Description of The University of Manchester Library, Gaster Hebrew MS 1090: Sefer Goralot

notesStmt.note: Two different types of paper: the first, thicker, with watermarks (see for example folios 14 and 16), is used for folios 1-20; the second one is used for the rest of the manuscript.
Stub between folios 3 and 4, and 4 and 5 (no textual lacuna).

msContents.summary: Composite codex containing two copies of the text Sefer Goralot (Book of Lots). A lot (גורל) is cast to find an answer to a question that is important to the individual casting it. The Book of Lots consists of an introductory text, which includes a prayer to be recited before a lot is cast, and several tables. The last table surveys sixty prophets from Adam to Ezra who give twelve answers to different questions. This table can presumably be consulted in conjunction with the first two, which are subdivided into twelve zodiacal signs plus each sign into five further "faces" of in total sixty prophets. The first table, entitled "Table of the Faces" (לוח הפרצופים), also lists the issues for which a "yes" or "no" answer is sought (e.g. success/failure in business etc.). Magical signs on folio 20b.

supportDesc.foliation: Modern pencil foliation in Arabic numerals at the top outer corner of recto of each folio. Two unnumbered blank folios between folio 20 and folio 21, and two unnumbered blank folios after folio 34. Second foliation in Hebrew letters at the top outer corner of recto of each folio on folios 1-20, from 31 [לא] to 50 [נ].

p.signatures: Quire signature in Italian at the bottom left corner of folios 1a [Qu.5], 7a [Qu.6] and 15a [Qu.7].

p.catchwords: Catchword at the bottom left corner of side b of folios 1-3, 22-33.

layoutDesc.layout: MS 1090/1, long line with a maximum of 29 written lines. Pricking and hard point ruling visible. On folios 1b-2a the text is written in an inverted triangle shape. MS 1090/2, long line with a maximum of 34 written lines.

decoDesc.decoNote: Inside front coverNumber 1090 handwritten in blue crayon.
[Flyleaf 1a]Printed fragment glued to paper containing a bibliographical entry for the manuscript content in Hebrew.
1aHandwritten note in Hebrew reading "גורלות העתקות של ס׳"
1aHandwritten in ink and in pencil number 1090 and Moses Gaster's signature.

binding.p: Modern green cloth binding. Handwritten label on spine reading "ב׳ ספרי גורלות / 1090"

origin.p: Produced in the seventeenth or eighteenth century

history.provenance: Acquired by The John Rylands Library from the heirs of Moses Gaster in 1954.
